hypothesis_content.title: VIX Spike Fade in Crypto During Neutral Regime
hypothesis_content.statement: When the 1-day realized volatility of BTC spikes to >1.5x its 20-day average during a NEUTRAL regime (as defined by FjordHQ regime detector), and price is trading within the middle 50% of its 20-day range, volatility will mean-revert within 3 days, favoring short volatility strategies.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes characterized by range-bound price action. Volatility spikes without clear directional catalysts (price mid-range) often represent noise rather than trend initiation. Inverted term structure suggests front-loaded fear that typically fades.
entry_conditions: BTC 1-day realized volatility > 1.5 * 20-day average realized volatility
BTC price between 25th and 75th percentile of 20-day range
Term structure of BTC options (30d-7d IV) ≤ 0 (flat or inverted)

exit_conditions.take_profit: 1-day realized volatility declines to ≤ 1.1x its 20-day average
exit_conditions.stop_loss: 1-day realized volatility increases to > 2x its 20-day average

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If volatility continues expanding beyond 2x average instead of mean-reverting in >60% of neutral regime occurrences.
